p: As shown in Table 3, all fractions produced wound healing activity at varying degrees. The 5% (w/w) and 10% (w/w) preparations of ethyl acetate and aqueous fractions produced significant wound contraction ( P<0.01) beginning from the 4th day of post-wounding as compared to negative control. The 10% (w/w) and 5% (w/w) chloroform fraction showed significant wound contraction beginning from the 6th and 8th post-wounding days, respectively. Besides, all fractions produced a significant reduction ( P<0.01) in epithelialization period as compared to negative control, though there were observable differences among them ( Figure 4).
